BEFORE THE STATE OIL AND GAS BOARD OF MISSISSIPPI
DOCKET NO.  446-2025-D
PUBLIC NOTICE
TO ALL PERSONS INTERESTED IN THE FOLLOWING WELLS LOCATED IN MIDWAY DOME FIELD, LAMAR COUNTY, MISSISSIPPI
   Allar Company No. 1, Section 33-T4N-R15W
   Allar No. 2, Section 34-T4N-R15W
    PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that beginning at 9:00 a.m. on the 17th day of December, 2025, in the hearing room, Suite E, 500 Greymont Avenue, Jackson, Mississippi, the State Oil and Gas Board will hear the Petition of Texas Petroleum Investment Company requesting an extension of the inactive well classification under Statewide Rule 28 for the above listed wells located in Midway Dome Field, Lamar County, Mississippi.
    A copy of said Petition is on file in the office of the State Oil and Gas Board, Suite E, 500 Greymont Avenue, Jackson, Mississippi, and may be there examined by any person interested. At said hearing, all interested persons may appear and be heard.
    If you intend to contest the docket or request a continuance you must notify the Board and the Petitioner's attorney of your intention in writing not later than 5:00 p.m., December 9, 2025.  Failure to so notify the Petitioner's attorney shall be a waiver of your right to contest or request continuance.
    You are advised the Board may adopt orders concerning the Petition which may differ from the relief requested by the Petitioner and the Board will enter such order or orders as in its judgment may be appropriate in accordance with the evidence presented.
    DATED at Jackson, Mississippi, this the 17th day of October, 2025.
MISSISSIPPI STATE OIL AND GAS BOARD
BY:  JESS NEW
State Oil and Gas Supervisor
PETITIONER'S ATTORNEY:
ROCKY W. EATON
P.O. Box 13309
Jackson, MS  39236
601-707-3440
eaton@hubbardmitchell.com
October 29 2025

Summons by Publication
IN THE MATTER OF THE ESTATE OF
JO ANN DAVIS, DECEASED
        
JANNI DYKES, PETITIONER CAUSE NO.: 25-pr-215-SM

SUMMONS BY PUBLICATION

TO: ALL THE KNOWN AND UNKNOWN HEIRS AT LAW OF JO ANN DAVIS, DECEASED
You have been summoned in the Petition filed in this Court by Janni Dykes, Administratrix for the Estate, seeking to determine the Heirs at Law of Jo Ann Davis, Deceased.
You are summoned to appear regarding said petition to 9:00 a.m. on the 3rd day of December, 2025, in the courtroom of the Lamar County Courthouse at Purvis, Mississippi, and in case of your failure to appear and defend a judgment will be entered for the things demanded in the Petition.
Should you not be able to attend the hearing on the 3rd day of December, 2025, you are required to mail or hand-deliver a written response to the Petition filed in this action to John Alan Buffington, Attorney for the Estate, whose address is Post Office Box 142, Collins, Mississippi, 39428 and whose street address is 601 South 2ND Street, Collins, MS 39428.
Issued under my hand and seal of said Court, this 20th day of October, 2025.

Lance C. Reid, Chancery Clerk
P.O. Box 951
Hattiesburg, MS 39403
BY: /s/ Sandra Bounds, D.C.

LMSS0395769

ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS

FTA SIDEWALK PROJECT GRACE AVENUE
CITY OF HATTIESBURG, MISSISSIPPI
Sealed bids will be received by the City of Hattiesburg, at the City Clerk's office, MS, hereafter referred to as Owner, located at 200 Forrest Street, Hattiesburg,MS, 39401, until 10:00 A.M., Local Time, Thursday, December 4th, 2025 for supplying all labor, equipment, and materials (as specified) necessary for the construction of the above referenced project. Work consists of sidewalk, driveways, and curb and gutter along Grace Avenue from W 7th Street to Southview Drive. When bids are submitted electronically, the same requirements for submitting sealed bids shall apply. Electronic bids shall be submitted online at www.hattiesburgmsbids.com and shall include a document representing the cover of the envelope containing the aforementioned criteria.

The above general outline of features of the work does not in any way limit the responsibility of the Contractor to perform all work and furnish all labor, equipment and materials required by the specifications and the drawings referred to therein.

Bidder must be qualified under Mississippi Law and show current Certificate of Responsibility issued by the Mississippi State Board of Public Contractors establishing his classification as to the value and type of construction on which he is authorized to bid.

Each Bidder shall write his Certificate of Responsibility Number on the outside of the sealed envelope containing his proposal.

Proposals shall be submitted in duplicate, sealed and deposited with the Owner prior to the hour and date hereinbefore designated. No bidder may withdraw his bid within 90 days after the actual date of the opening thereof.

Awarding public contracts to non-resident Bidders will be on the same basis as the non-resident bidder's state awards contracts to Mississippi Contractors bidding under similar circumstances. In order to ensure that Mississippi's so-called Golden Rule is followed state law requires a non-resident bidder is to attach to his bid a copy of his resident state's current laws pertaining to such state's treatment of non-resident contractors.

Each Bidder must deposit with his proposal, a Bid Bond or Certified Check in an amount equal to 5% of his bid, payable to the Owner, as bid security. Bidders shall also submit a current financial statement, if requested, by the Owner. The successful bidder will be required to furnish a Payment Bond and Performance
Bond each in the amount of 100% of the contract amount.

Bid documents are being made available via paper copy or pdf. All interested bidders are required to log-in or register for an account at www.hattiesburgmsbids.com OR www.neel-schafferplans.com to view and order Bid Documents. All plan holders are required to have a valid email address for registration. Bid documents are non-refundable and must be purchased through the website. Questions regarding website registration and online orders please contact Plan House Printing at (601) 336-6378.

Mississippi Standard Specifications for Road and Bridge Construction, 2017 Edition as referred to herein, may be purchased from the Mississippi Department of Transportation.

The Owner hereby notifies all Bidders that it will affirmatively insure that in any contract entered into pursuant to this advertisement, disadvantaged and women's business enterprises will be afforded the full opportunity to submit bids in response to this invitation and will not be discriminated against on the grounds of race, color, or national origin in consideration for an award.

The Engineer is Neel-Schaffer, Inc., 704 Hardy Street, Hattiesburg, MS 39401; Phone No. (601) 545-1565. Dustin Gatlin, P.E.*Engineer Manager.

The Owner reserves the right to reject any and all bids and to waive any informalities or irregularities therein.
BY: City Clerk - City of Hattiesburg, MS
ADVERTISING DATES: October 26, 2025 & November 2, 2025
October 26, November 2 2025

Public Notice
Mississippi Environmental Quality Permit Board
P. O. Box 2261 | Jackson, MS 39225
515 East Amite St. | Jackson, MS 39201
Telephone No. (601) 961-5171
 
Public Notice Start Date: October 22, 2025
 
MDEQ Contact: Deanna Rush
 
Cooperative Energy, a Mississippi Electric Cooperative, R D Morrow Sr Generating Plant, located at 304 Old Okahola School Road in Purvis, MS, (601) 268-2083, has applied to the Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality (MDEQ) for the following permitting action: Reissuance of National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Permit No. MS0028258. The applicant's operations fall within SIC Code 4911 (Electric Services). R.D. Morrow Sr Generating Plant generates a combined maximum electric power output of 572 MW using a natural gas fired combined cycle combustion turbine equipped with a heat recovery steam generator. The facility is an NPDES Major Source.
The proposed permit describes two external outfalls (Outfall 002 and Outfall 007) and three internal outfalls (Outfalls 201, 202 and 203). Outfall 002 discharges effluent at a flowrate of 6.13 MGD (maximum monthly average) into Black Creek from a pond that collects cooling water blowdown and wastewater from Internal Outfalls 201, 202, 203. Outfall 002 effluent consists of cooling tower blowdown, low volume waste, metal cleaning waste, chemical metal cleaning waste, treated sanitary wastewater, and stormwater. Outfall 007 discharges effuent at a flowrate of 0.29 MGD into an unnamed tributary of Black Creek. Effluent from Outfall 007 consists of leachate and stormwater runoff from the closed coal combustion by-product landfill. Internal Outfall 006 has been removed from the draft permit.
A Statement of Basis has been prepared that contains a discussion of the decision-making that went into the development of the permit and provides the permitting authority, the public, and other government bodies a record of the technical issues surrounding issuance of the permit. The Statement of Basis also addresses any changes to emissions and/or discharges resulting from any modification of the facility.
The staff of the Permit Board has developed this draft permit based on information submitted to the Permit Board by the applicant, appropriate State and Federal agencies and other interested parties. The staff of the Permit Board is soliciting all relative information pertaining to the proposed activity, including public comment, to ensure that the final staff recommendation on the draft permit complies with all State and Federal regulations. Public review and comment on the draft permit and supporting documentation is an important element in the staff evaluation and resulting recommendation to the Permit Board. The draft permit conditions have been developed to ensure compliance with all State and Federal regulations but are subject to change based on information received as a result of public participation.
Persons wishing to comment upon or object to the proposed determinations are invited to submit comments in writing to DEANNA RUSH at https://www.mdeq.ms.gov/rush-deanna/ or to the Permit Board address shown above, no later than the end of the thirty (30) day public notice. All comments received by this date will be considered in the formulation of final determinations regarding the application. A public hearing will be held if the Permit Board finds a significant degree of public interest in the proposed permit. Persons wishing to request a public hearing may do so by submitting that request in writing to DEANNA RUSH at https://www.mdeq.ms.gov/rush-deanna/ or to the Permit Board address shown above. The Permit Board is limited in the scope of its analysis to environmental impact. Any comments relative to zoning or economic and social impacts are within the jurisdiction of local zoning and planning authorities and should be addressed to them.
Additional details about the application, including a copy of the draft permit, are available by writing or calling the Public Records Request Officer at the above Permit Board address and telephone number or by completing the form at the following website: https://www.mdeq.ms.gov/about-mdeq/public-records-request/public-records-request-form/. Additionally, a copy of the draft permit and statement of basis may be found on the MDEQ’s website at: https://opc.deq.state.ms.us/publicnotice.aspx. This information is also available for review at the office of the MDEQ at the Permit Board address shown above during normal business hours. Please bring the foregoing to the attention of persons whom you know will be interested.

THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI
TO:      Any and all unknown heirs-at-law of Ked Eccles-James, Deceased, if any, and all persons or entities unknown claiming any interest in the Estate of Ked Eccles-James, Deceased.

You have been made a Defendant in the suit filed in this Court by M. William Morgan, Petitioner, seeking to have Michael Chudi Eccles-James, Nkechi Jamine James-Gillman, and Ijeoma Genevieve Eccles-James established as the heirs-at-law of Ked Eccles-James, Deceased.

(MERS), as beneficiary, as nominee for Stockton Mortgage Corporation, its successors and assigns, as Beneficiary, the hereinafter described property; and
WHEREAS, Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc. (MERS), as beneficiary, as nominee for Stockton Mortgage Corporation, its successors and assigns assigned said Deed of Trust to Lakeview Loan Servicing, LLC via an instrument dated May 12, 2025 and recorded in Book 2578, Page 158 - and as Instrument No. 876039 - in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and

WHEREAS, on August 31, 2017, MICHAEL A LYON, MARRIED MAN, AND MELISSA L. LYON, HIS WIFE, executed a Deed of Trust to FIRST AMERICAN TITLE, as Trustee and, Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc., solely as nominee for MORTGAGE RESEARCH CENTER, LLC DBA VETERANS UNITED HOME LOANS., A MISSOURI LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY, as Beneficiary, which Deed of Trust is on file and of record in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi, in Book 2140, Page 120 and as Instrument Number 765661; and
WHEREAS, Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc., solely as nominee for MORTGAGE RESEARCH CENTER, LLC DBA VETERANS UNITED HOME LOANS assigned said Deed of Trust to Nationstar Mortgage, LLC d/b/a Mr. Cooper via an instrument dated March 18, 2019 and recorded in Book 2223, Page 586 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, Nationstar Mortgage, LLC d/b/a Mr. Cooper appointed McCalla Raymer Leibert Pierce, LLC as Substitute Trustee in place of the afore-mentioned Deed of Trust via an instrument recorded in Book 2257, Page 203 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, Nationstar Mortgage, LLC d/b/a Mr. Cooper assigned said Deed of Trust to Allied First Bank, SB dba ServBank via an instrument dated March 18, 2019 and recorded in Book 2557, Page 299 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, the subject mortgage loan was modified via an instrument recorded in Book 2446, Page 332 – and as Instrument No. 841896 - in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, the subject mortgage loan was again modified via an instrument recorded in Book 2562, Page 144 – and as Instrument No. 872035 - in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, ServBank, N.A. substituted Padget Law Group as Trustee in place of the afore-mentioned original Trustee and substitute Trustee via an instrument dated August 21, 2025 and recorded in Book 2594, Page 570 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, default has occurred in the payment of the indebtedness secured by said deed(s) of trust, and SERVBANK, N.A., as beneficiary, has authorized and instructed Padgett Law Group as substitute trustee to foreclose said deed(s) of trust by advertisement and sale at public auction in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor.
THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that pursuant to the power of sale contained in said deed(s) of trust and in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor, the said deed(s) of trust will be foreclosed and the property covered thereby and hereinafter described will be sold at public auction to the highest bidder for cash at the Northeast rear entrance of the Paul B. Johnson Chancery Building in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, and will sell within legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 AM and 4:00 PM) on October 10, 2025, to satisfy the indebtedness now due under and secured by said deed(s) of trust.
Padgett Law Group will convey only such title as vested in it as Substituted Trustee.
The premises to be sold are described as:
Lot 19 of Sherwood Forest First Addition as per map or plat thereof on file in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi;
LESS AND EXCEPT: Begin at the point of intersection of the Easterly line of grantor's property with the present Northerly right of way line of Mississippi Highway No. 42 as shown on the plans for Federal Aid Project No. 46-0063-02-012-10 at Highway Survey Station 19+594.205; from said Point of Beginning run thence South 87°44'40 West along said present Northerly right of way line a distance of 81.991 meters (268.999 feet) to the present Easterly right of way line of Manor Drive; thence run North 02°26'32 West along the present Easterly right of way line of said Manor Drive a distance of 14.760 meters (48.425 feet); thence run North 87°44'40 East along a line that is 30.000 meters (98.425 feet) Northerly of and parallel with the centerline of survey of said project a distance of 81.991 meters (268.999 feet) to the Easterly line of grantor's property; thence run South 02°26'32 East along said Easterly property line a distance of 14.760 meters (48.425 feet) to the Point of Beginning; containing 0.121 hectares (0.299 acres), more or less, and being situated in and a part of Lot 19, Sherwood Forest First Addition Subdivision as recorded in Plat Book 13, Page 6 in the Chancery Clerk's office of Forrest County, Mississippi, Section 34, Township 5 North, Range 12 West.
The successful bidder must tender full funds at the conclusion of the sale in the form of a certified check made payable or endorsed to Padgett Law Group. No personal checks will be accepted. To this end you must bring sufficient funds to outbid the lender and any other bidders. Insufficient funds will not be accepted. Amounts received in excess of the winning bid will be refunded. Padgett Law Group reserves the right to award the bid to the next highest bidders should the highest bidder fail to timely tender the total amount due.

Hattiesburg Public Schools
Request for Proposals
Bid# 26-009
2025 Lawn Care Services - Project B
The Board of Trustees of the Hattiesburg Public School District (HPS), Hattiesburg, Mississippi, will receive sealed bids/proposals in the Central Office Conference Room located at 301 Mamie Street, Hattiesburg, Mississippi, until Monday, October 20, 2025, until 9:00 a.m. CST.  The Board of Trustees reserves the following rights:
To appoint or authorize a person or persons to evaluate bids/proposals, act, and make decisions on matters pertaining to bids.
To reject any and/or all bids/proposals of any groups thereof and waive any informalities.
To adjust quantities of supplies or services involved under any item in accordance with the square foot pricing submitted as part of the bid/proposal.
Award the bid to one or more vendors.
The contract will be awarded to the lowest and best bidder, as defined in Miss. Code Ann. §31-7-13.  The Hattiesburg Public School District reserves the right to waive any and all informalities and to reject any and all bids.
 
The above bids/proposals will be opened in the Central Office Conference Room, 301 Mamie Street, Hattiesburg, Mississippi, on Monday, October 20, 2025, at 9:00 a.m. CST.  All bids/proposals shall be submitted to this address on or before the above time and date.  Envelopes containing bids/proposals shall be plainly marked 2025 Lawn Care Services - Project B, ATTN: Edith Stallings.  Any notations appearing on the outside of envelopes containing the sealed bids/proposals that are intended to amend the bids in any manner will not be considered.  

No bids/proposals may be withdrawn for a period of ninety (90) days following the scheduled opening date or until the Board of Trustees approves the contract.
Bidders must be licensed to do business in the State of Mississippi.

The District Contact person for Specifics and Site Visit: Stephen McCay, Director of Operations, stephen.mccay@hattiesburgpsd.com

The District Contact person for Proposal Instructions and Timelines: Edith Stallings, Accounting Supervisor, edith.stallings@hattiesburgpsd.com

/s/ Robert Williams
Superintendent of Education

Public Notice Start Date: October 2, 2025
MDEQ Contact: Sandeepa Gill
Hattiesburg South Lagoon, located at 1903 East Hardy Street, in Hattiesburg, MS, (601) 545-4501, has applied to the Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality (MDEQ) for the following permitting action(s): Reissuance of Ref. No. MS0020303. The applicant's operations fall within SIC Code 4952.
Municipal NPDES Permit No. MS0020303, Hattiesburg South Lagoon located at 1903 East Hardy Street, in Hattiesburg, Mississippi discharges treated domestic wastewater into Leaf River. The applicant's operation is the collection and treatment of domestic wastewater. Only one discharge to surface waters is described within the application.
The staff of the Permit Board has developed this draft permit based on information submitted to the Permit Board by the applicant, appropriate State and Federal agencies and other interested parties. The staff of the Permit Board is soliciting all relative information pertaining to the proposed activity, including public comment, to ensure that the final staff recommendation on the draft permit complies with all State and Federal regulations. Public review and comment on the draft permit and supporting documentation is an important element in the staff evaluation and resulting recommendation to the Permit Board. The draft permit conditions have been developed to ensure compliance with all State and Federal regulations but are subject to change based on information received as a result of public participation.
Persons wishing to comment upon or object to the proposed determinations are invited to submit comments in writing to Sandeepa Gill at https://www.mdeq.ms.gov/gill-sandeepa/ or to the Permit Board address shown above, no later than the end of the thirty (30) day public notice. All comments received by this date will be considered in the formulation of final determinations regarding the application(s). A public hearing will be held if the Permit Board finds a significant degree of public interest in the proposed permit(s). Persons wishing to request a public hearing may do so by submitting that request in writing to Bradley Crain at https://www.mdeq.ms.gov/crain-bradley/ or to the Permit Board address shown above. The Permit Board is limited in the scope of its analysis to environmental impact. Any comments relative to zoning or economic and social impacts are within the jurisdiction of local zoning and planning authorities and should be addressed to them.
Additional details about the application, including a copy of the draft permit, are available by writing or calling the Public Records Request Officer at the above Permit Board address and telephone number or by completing the form at the following website: https://www.mdeq.ms.gov/about-mdeq/public-records-request/public-records-request-form/. Additionally, a copy of the draft permit and statement of basis may be found on the MDEQ’s website at: https://opc.deq.state.ms.us/publicnotice.aspx . This information is also available for review at the office of the MDEQ at the Permit Board address shown above during normal business hours. Please bring the foregoing to the attention of persons whom you know will be interested.

NOTICE OF SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S SALE
WHEREAS, Victor F. Hogan, executed a Deed of Trust dated February 21, 2020, to Steve Taylor as Trustee for the benefit of BankFirst Financial Services, which Deed of Trust is recorded in Trust Deed Book 1786 at Page 369, in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Lamar County, Mississippi; and
   WHEREAS, BankFirst Financial Services subsequently appointed Hubbard, Mitchell, Williams & Strain, PLLC as Substitute Trustee on October 20, 2025, by instrument recorded in Book Number 2130, pages 157-58 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Lamar County, Mississippi; and
   WHEREAS, default has been made in the terms and conditions of said Deed of Trust and the entire debt secured thereby having been declared to be due and payable in accordance with the terms of said Deed of Trust, and the holder of said indebtedness having requested the undersigned Substitute Trustee to execute the trust and sell said land in accordance with the terms and conditions of said Deed of Trust,
   NOW, THEREFORE, Hubbard, Mitchell, Williams & Strain, PLLC, Substitute Trustee, under the terms and provisions of and by virtue of the authority conferred upon it in said Deed of Trust, will on the 7th day of January, 2026, offer for sale at public outcry and sell within legal hours, being between 11:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., on the front steps of the Chancery Courthouse of Lamar County, at Purvis, Mississippi, to the highest and best bidder for cash, the lands lying and being situated in Lamar County, Mississippi, together with all improvements and appurtenances, (the Property) described more particularly as follows, to-wit:
   Lot 5 of Southern Lane Estates Subdivision or Addition to Lamar County, Mississippi, as per the official map or plat thereof on file in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Lamar County, Mississippi; all together with all improvements thereon and appurtenances thereunto belonging.
   I will sell and convey only such interest as is vested in me as Substitute Trustee.
   WITNESS my signature this 3rd day of December, 2025.

SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE SALE
 
WHEREAS on March 23, 2022, EARNESTINE MOORE, A SINGLE WOMAN, executed a Deed of Trust to PILGER TITLE CO., as Trustee , and MORTGAGE ELECTRONIC REGISTRATION SYSTEM, SOLELY AS NOMINEE FOR CALIBER HOME LOANS, INC, its successors and assigns, as Beneficiary, which Deed of Trust is on file and of record in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest, Mississippi, in Deed of Trust Record at Book 2416, Page 517 – and as Instrument Number 835431; and
WHEREAS, MORTGAGE ELECTRONIC REGISTRATION SYSTEM, SOLELY AS NOMINEE FOR CALIBER HOME LOANS, INC. duly transferred and assigned said Deed of Trust to NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing via an instrument filed on March 21,y 2023, in Book 2472, Page 715.
WHEREAS, NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing substituted Padgett Law Group as Trustee in place of the afore-mentioned original Trustee via an instrument dated November 17, 2025 and recorded in Book 2607, Page 672 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, default has occurred in the payment of the indebtedness secured by said deed(s) of trust, and NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, as beneficiary, has authorized and instructed Padgett Law Group as substitute trustee to foreclose said deed(s) of trust by advertisement and sale at public auction in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor.
THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that pursuant to the power of sale contained in said deed(s) of trust and in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor, the said deed(s) of trust will be foreclosed and the property covered thereby and hereinafter described will be sold at public auction to the highest bidder for cash at the northeast rear entrance of the Paul B. Johnson Chancery Building in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, and will sell within legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 AM and 4:00 PM) on December 18, 2025, to satisfy the indebtedness now due under and secured by said deed(s) of trust.
Padgett Law Group will convey only such title as vested in it as Substituted Trustee. The premises to be sold are described as:
THE SOUTH 30 FEET OF LOT 4 AND ALL OF LOT 5 OF BLOCK 21 OF THE HATTIESBURG HEIGHTS PROPER SURVEY TO THE CITY OF HATTIESBURG, COUNTY OF FORREST, STATE OF MISSISSIPPI, AS PER THE MAP OR PLAT THEREOF ON FILE IN THE OFFICE OF THE CHANCERY CLERK OF FORREST COUNTY.
The successful bidder must tender full funds at the conclusion of the sale in the form of a certified check made payable or endorsed to Padgett Law Group. No personal checks will be accepted. To this end you must bring sufficient funds to outbid the lender and any other bidders. Insufficient funds will not be accepted. Amounts received in excess of the winning bid will be refunded. Padgett Law Group reserves the right to award the bid to the next highest bidders should the highest bidder fail to timely tender the total amount due.
 
November 20, 2025

STATE OF MISSISSIPPI
COUNTY OF FORREST
 
TO: ANY AND ALL UNKNOWN HEIRS AT LAW OF KONELL LEROY BARNES, JR., DECEASED.
 
NOTICE TO DEFENDANT
 
You have been made Defendants in a suit filed in this Court by Petitioner, April Anderson, seeking an adjudication of the heirs-at-law of Konell Leroy Barnes, Jr., deceased.
 
You are summoned to appear and defend against said Petition to Determine Heirs and Wrongful Death Beneficiaries filed against you in this action at 9:00 o’clock a.m. on the 22nd day of January, 2026, before the Honorable Chase Morgan in the courtroom 3 of the Forrest County Chancery Court in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, and in case of your failure to appear and defend, a judgment will be entered against you for the relief demanded in the Petition to Determine Heirs and Wrongful Death Beneficiaries. You are not required to file an answer or other pleading but you made do so if you desire.
 
Issued under my hand and the seal of said Court, this the 25th day of November, 2025.
 
LANCE C. REID,

STATE OF MISSISSIPPI
COUNTY OF FORREST
 
WHEREAS, on September 9, 2008, Brenda C. Sanderson and Mark Sanderson executed a deed of trust to First American Title, Trustee for the benefit of Vanderbilt Mortgage and Finance, Inc., which deed of trust was recorded on September 16, 2008, Book 1660 at Page 398 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
 
WHEREAS, Vanderbilt Mortgage and Finance, Inc., the holder of said deed of trust and the note secured thereby, substituted Lori C. WHEREAS, default having been made in the terms and conditions of said deed of trust, and the entire debt secured thereby having been declared to be due and payable in accordance with the terms of said deed of trust, and the legal holder of said indebtedness, Vanderbilt Mortgage and Finance, Inc., having requested the undersigned Substitute Trustee to execute the trust and sell said land and property in accordance with the terms of said deed of trust for the purpose of raising the sums due thereunder, together with attorney’s fees, substitute trustee’s fees and expenses of sale;
 
NOW, THEREFORE, I, Lori C. Johnson, Jr., Chancery Building, located at 641 Main Street, in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, the following described property situated in the County of Forrest, State of Mississippi, to-wit:
 
A part of the NW ¼ of the SW ¼ of Section 2, Township 5 North, Range 14 West, Forrest County, Mississippi, and being more particularly described as beginning 840 feet North of the SE corner of the N ½ of the SW ¼ of the SW ¼ of said Section 2 and thence run North for 369.60 feet; thence run West for 380.00 to the Point of Beginning; thence continue West for 250.00 feet; thence run S 00° 39’ 31” E for 174.46 feet; thence run East for 250.00 feet; thence run N 00° 39’ 31” W for 174.46 feet to the Point of Beginning, comprising 1 acre, more or less.
 
AND ALSO AN EASEMENT FOR INGRESS AND EGRESS:
 
A part of the NW ¼ of the SW ¼ and a part of the SW ¼ of the SW ¼, all in Section 2, Township 5 North, Range 14 West, Forrest County, Mississippi, being more particularly described as: Beginning at a point on the centerline of a 20 foot Access Easement being 10 feet either side of the following described centerline that is located 1036.00 feet North of and 618.00 feet West of the SE corner of the N ½ of the said SW ¼ of the said SW ¼; thence run S 00° 40’ 14” E along said centerline for 70.21 feet; thence run West along said centerline for 356.04 feet; thence run S 00° 04’ 05” W along said centerline for 20.00 feet; thence run West along said centerline for 108.00 feet; thence run S 08° 00’ 00” W along said centerline for 536.00 feet to a point on the North right of way line of Pep’s Point Road, said point being the Point of Termination. Sealed Bids for Flint Creek Campground Expansion - Tallulah
The Pat Harrison Waterway District shall receive separate sealed bids for the Flint Creek Campground Expansion*Tallulah Campground no later than 10:00 A.M., Local Time, January 8, 2026 at Pat Harrison Waterway District Office, 17 JM Tatum Industrial Drive #120, Hattiesburg, Mississippi 39401. All bids so received will be publicly opened and read aloud.
Work shall consist of work related to the construction of a bathhouse and utilities for a new RV campground loop and bathhouse.
Minority and women's business enterprises are solicited to bid on this contract as prime contractors and are encouraged to make inquiries regarding potential sub-contracting opportunities, equipment, material and/or supply needs. Pat Harrison Waterway District is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pat Harrison Waterway District hereby notifies all Bidders that it will affirmatively insure that a contract entered into pursuant to this advertisement will be afforded the full opportunity to submit bids in response to this invitation and will not be discriminated against on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual preference, marital or veteran status, or any legally protected status in consideration for an award.
The PLANS, SPECIFICATIONS AND CONTRACT DOCUMENTS may be examined at the following locations:
1. Tice Engineering, Inc., 510 South Vardaman Street, Wiggins, Mississippi, 39577
2. Pat Harrison Waterway District Office, 17 JM Tatum Industrial Drive #120, Hattiesburg, Mississippi 39401
All documents required for bidding purposes may be obtained from www.ticeengplans.com upon payment of a nonrefundable fee for each set. The successful bidder will be required to furnish a Performance Bond and a Payment bond each in the amount of one hundred percent (100%) of the contract amount.
A complete bid proposal shall be submitted in a sealed envelope and deposited with Pat Harrison Waterway District Office, 17 JM Tatum Industrial Drive #120, Hattiesburg, Mississippi 39401 prior to the hour and date above designated. The Pat Harrison Waterway District has the right to reject any and all bids received.
December 3, 10 2025

INVITATION FOR BIDS-REVERSE AUCTION
 
Notice is hereby given that Southeast Mississippi Air Ambulance District (SEMAAD) will receive sealed bids to prequalify bidders for participation in a reverse auction until 10:00 a.m. on the 15th day of December 2025, for the purchase of the following, to wit:
 
One (1) ambulance remount on a 2025 or newer chassis according to the specifications on file in the office of the Chief Executive Officer of SEMAAD whose office is located at:
 
100 Rawls Springs Loop Road,Hattiesburg,Mississippi, 39402
(P.O. Box 17889, Hattiesburg, MS 39404-7889).
 
Bid documents/specifications may be obtained from SEMAAD, as referenced above, at no charge, or online at http://www.centralbidding.com, for a charge of $99.00.
 
Each bidder shall include in its bid a detailed description of the ambulance remount it is offering and the pricing for same, inclusive of the trade-in amount offered for the agency’s existing original chassis.
 
Bid documents may be submitted by hand delivery or mail to SEMAAD, 100 Rawls Springs Loop Road, Hattiesburg, Mississippi 39402 or at http://www.centralbidding.com.
 
All bidders submitting qualified bids will be notified by SEMAAD of the reverse auction start date/time at least seven (7) days prior to such reverse auction start date/time.
 
The lowest and best bid may be accepted, but SEMAAD reserves the right to reject any and all bids received and to waive formalities. So ordered on the Board meeting of July
16, 2025.
 
BOARD OF DIRECTORS SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AIR AMBULANCE DISTRICT
BY: /s/ Dr. J. Keith Speed, President

PUBLIC NOTICE
TAKE NOTICE that Pistol Ridge Partners, LLC. (Petitioner) has filed a Petition with the Mississippi State Oil and Gas Board under the above docket requesting an extension of the inactive well classification under Statewide Rule 28 for the Delphi 6-17 #1 Section 6 T1S, R13W, Forrest County, Mississippi in the referenced field as identified on Exhibit A to the petition and for together relief as set forth in the Petition.  The Petition in this matter is on file in the records in the office of the Mississippi State Oil and Gas Board and may there be examined.
The Petition will be heard by said Board at 09:00 am on the 17th day of December 2025 at 500 Greymont Avenue, Suite E., Jackson, Mississippi 39202, at which time and place you may appear and contest, said matter.
If you intend to contest the Docket or request a continuance you must notify the Board and the Petitioner's representative of your intention in writing not later than 5:00 p.m. Tuesday December 09, 2025, which is seven (7) days prior to the date stated above for the hearing.   Failure to so notify the Board and the Petitioner's representative shall be a waiver of your right to contest or request a continuance.
You are advised the Board may adopt an order concerning a Petition, which may differ from the relief requested by Petitioner and the Board will enter such order or orders as its judgment may be appropriate in accordance with the evidence presented.

SUBSTITUTED TRUSTEE’S NOTICE OF SALE
 
WHEREAS, Kelvin Anderson executed a Deed of Trust, dated March 22, 2021, to Granville Tate, Jr., Trustee, in favor of Trustmark National Bank, which Deed of Trust was recorded on April 14, 2021, in Book 2349 at Page 359-370, in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi (the “Deed of Trust”); and
WHEREAS, on August 4, 2025, Trustmark Bank, a Mississippi banking corporation became successor in interest to Trustmark National Bank by virtue of those certain Articles of Incorporation and Articles of Conversion filed of record with the Mississippi Secretary of State (“Trustmark”); and
WHEREAS, on September 15, 2025, Trustmark appointed and substituted Jim F. Spencer, Jr. as Substituted Trustee in the place and stead of Granville Tate, Jr., the original trustee of the Deed of Trust, as was its right to do under the terms of said Deed of Trust, said Substitution of Trustee being recorded on September 22, 2025, in Book 2598 at Page 297, in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, on October 15, 2025, Trustmark executed a Partial Release of certain property owned by Subrina Mason, and which Partial Release was recorded on October 22, 2025, in Book 2603, at Page 329, in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, default having been made in the terms and conditions of said Deed of Trust, and the entire debt secured having been declared due and payable in accordance with the terms of said Deed of Trust, and the legal holder of said indebtedness, Trustmark, having requested the undersigned Substituted Trustee to execute the trust and sell said land and property in accordance with the terms of said Deed of Trust for the purpose of raising sums due thereunder together with attorney’s fees and expenses of sale;
NOW, THEREFORE, I, Jim F. Spencer, Jr., the undersigned Substituted Trustee, will sell during the legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.) on the 4th day of December, 2025, at the Northeast main entrance (back door) of the County Courthouse in the City of Hattiesburg, Forrest County, Mississippi, for cash to the highest and best bidder, the following described land and property located and being situated in Forrest County, State of Mississippi and being more particularly described as follows, to-wit:
 
The Land referred to herein below is situated in the County of Forrest, State of Mississippi, and is described as follows:
 
Commence at a concrete monument at the SE Corner of the NE 1/4 of Section 6, T-5-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi and run North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along the South line of said NE 1/4 for 993.75 feet to a railroad spike and the centerline of Lott Town Road (Paved Public Road); thence continue North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 41.27 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar and the West R/w line of said Lott Town Road and the Point of Beginning. From said Point of Beginning continue North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 468.30 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence continue North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 608.01 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence run North 48 degrees 14 minutes 23 seconds E for 1083.40 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar and the aforementioned West R/W line of Lott Town Road; thence run South 07 degrees 47 minutes 22 seconds East along said R/W line for 381.30 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence continue along said R/W line and along a curve which bears to the left having a radius of 443.11 feet, a length of 283.12 feet, and a chord bearing and distance of South 26 degrees 24 minutes 15 seconds East and 278.33 feet, respectively, to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence run South 43 degrees 08 minutes 00 seconds East along said R/W line for 135.58 feet back to the Point of Beginning.
Said parcel is a part of the SE 1/4 of the NE 1/4 and a part of the SW 1/4 of the NE 1/4 of Section 6, T-5-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi and contains 8.00 acres, more or less.
Together with any improvements thereon and appurtenances thereunto belonging.

WHEREAS on March 23, 2022, EARNESTINE MOORE, A SINGLE WOMAN, executed a Deed of Trust to PILGER TITLE CO., as Trustee , and MORTGAGE ELECTRONIC REGISTRATION SYSTEM, SOLELY AS NOMINEE FOR CALIBER HOME LOANS, INC, its successors and assigns, as Beneficiary, which Deed of Trust is on file and of record in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest, Mississippi, in Deed of Trust Record at Book 2416, Page 517 – and as Instrument Number 835431; and
WHEREAS, MORTGAGE ELECTRONIC REGISTRATION SYSTEM, SOLELY AS NOMINEE FOR CALIBER HOME LOANS, INC. duly transferred and assigned said Deed of Trust to NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing via an instrument filed on March 21,y 2023, in Book 2472, Page 715.
WHEREAS, NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing substituted Padgett Law Group as Trustee in place of the afore-mentioned original Trustee via an instrument dated November 17, 2025 and recorded in Book 2607, Page 672 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, default has occurred in the payment of the indebtedness secured by said deed(s) of trust, and NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, as beneficiary, has authorized and instructed Padgett Law Group as substitute trustee to foreclose said deed(s) of trust by advertisement and sale at public auction in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor.
THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that pursuant to the power of sale contained in said deed(s) of trust and in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor, the said deed(s) of trust will be foreclosed and the property covered thereby and hereinafter described will be sold at public auction to the highest bidder for cash at the northeast rear entrance of the Paul B. Johnson Chancery Building in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, and will sell within legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 AM and 4:00 PM) on December 18, 2025, to satisfy the indebtedness now due under and secured by said deed(s) of trust.

THE SOUTH 30 FEET OF LOT 4 AND ALL OF LOT 5 OF BLOCK 21 OF THE HATTIESBURG HEIGHTS PROPER SURVEY TO THE CITY OF HATTIESBURG, COUNTY OF FORREST, STATE OF MISSISSIPPI, AS PER THE MAP OR PLAT THEREOF ON FILE IN THE OFFICE OF THE CHANCERY CLERK OF FORREST COUNTY.
The successful bidder must tender full funds at the conclusion of the sale in the form of a certified check made payable or endorsed to Padgett Law Group. No personal checks will be accepted. To this end you must bring sufficient funds to outbid the lender and any other bidders. Insufficient funds will not be accepted. Amounts received in excess of the winning bid will be refunded. Padgett Law Group reserves the right to award the bid to the next highest bidders should the highest bidder fail to timely tender the total amount due.

INVITATION FOR BIDS-REVERSE AUCTION
 
Notice is hereby given that Southeast Mississippi Air Ambulance District (SEMAAD) will receive sealed bids to prequalify bidders for participation in a reverse auction until 10:00 a.m. on the 15th day of December 2025, for the purchase of the following, to wit:
 
One (1) ambulance remount on a 2025 or newer chassis according to the specifications on file in the office of the Chief Executive Officer of SEMAAD whose office is located at:
 
100 Rawls Springs Loop Road,Hattiesburg,Mississippi, 39402
(P.O. Box 17889, Hattiesburg, MS 39404-7889).
 
Bid documents/specifications may be obtained from SEMAAD, as referenced above, at no charge, or online at http://www.centralbidding.com, for a charge of $99.00.
 
Each bidder shall include in its bid a detailed description of the ambulance remount it is offering and the pricing for same, inclusive of the trade-in amount offered for the agency’s existing original chassis.
 
Bid documents may be submitted by hand delivery or mail to SEMAAD, 100 Rawls Springs Loop Road, Hattiesburg, Mississippi 39402 or at http://www.centralbidding.com.
 
All bidders submitting qualified bids will be notified by SEMAAD of the reverse auction start date/time at least seven (7) days prior to such reverse auction start date/time.
 
The lowest and best bid may be accepted, but SEMAAD reserves the right to reject any and all bids received and to waive formalities. So ordered on the Board meeting of July
16, 2025.
 
BOARD OF DIRECTORS SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AIR AMBULANCE DISTRICT
BY: /s/ Dr. J. Keith Speed, President
July 16, 2025

SUBSTITUTED TRUSTEE’S NOTICE OF SALE
 
WHEREAS, Kelvin Anderson executed a Deed of Trust, dated March 22, 2021, to Granville Tate, Jr., Trustee, in favor of Trustmark National Bank, which Deed of Trust was recorded on April 14, 2021, in Book 2349 at Page 359-370, in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi (the “Deed of Trust”); and
WHEREAS, on August 4, 2025, Trustmark Bank, a Mississippi banking corporation became successor in interest to Trustmark National Bank by virtue of those certain Articles of Incorporation and Articles of Conversion filed of record with the Mississippi Secretary of State (“Trustmark”); and
WHEREAS, on September 15, 2025, Trustmark appointed and substituted Jim F. Spencer, Jr. as Substituted Trustee in the place and stead of Granville Tate, Jr., the original trustee of the Deed of Trust, as was its right to do under the terms of said Deed of Trust, said Substitution of Trustee being recorded on September 22, 2025, in Book 2598 at Page 297, in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, on October 15, 2025, Trustmark executed a Partial Release of certain property owned by Subrina Mason, and which Partial Release was recorded on October 22, 2025, in Book 2603, at Page 329, in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, default having been made in the terms and conditions of said Deed of Trust, and the entire debt secured having been declared due and payable in accordance with the terms of said Deed of Trust, and the legal holder of said indebtedness, Trustmark, having requested the undersigned Substituted Trustee to execute the trust and sell said land and property in accordance with the terms of said Deed of Trust for the purpose of raising sums due thereunder together with attorney’s fees and expenses of sale;
NOW, THEREFORE, I, Jim F. Spencer, Jr., the undersigned Substituted Trustee, will sell during the legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.) on the 4th day of December, 2025, at the Northeast main entrance (back door) of the County Courthouse in the City of Hattiesburg, Forrest County, Mississippi, for cash to the highest and best bidder, the following described land and property located and being situated in Forrest County, State of Mississippi and being more particularly described as follows, to-wit:
 
The Land referred to herein below is situated in the County of Forrest, State of Mississippi, and is described as follows:
 
Commence at a concrete monument at the SE Corner of the NE 1/4 of Section 6, T-5-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi and run North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along the South line of said NE 1/4 for 993.75 feet to a railroad spike and the centerline of Lott Town Road (Paved Public Road); thence continue North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 41.27 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar and the West R/w line of said Lott Town Road and the Point of Beginning. From said Point of Beginning continue North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 468.30 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence continue North 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 608.01 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence run North 48 degrees 14 minutes 23 seconds E for 1083.40 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar and the aforementioned West R/W line of Lott Town Road; thence run South 07 degrees 47 minutes 22 seconds East along said R/W line for 381.30 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence continue along said R/W line and along a curve which bears to the left having a radius of 443.11 feet, a length of 283.12 feet, and a chord bearing and distance of South 26 degrees 24 minutes 15 seconds East and 278.33 feet, respectively, to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence run South 43 degrees 08 minutes 00 seconds East along said R/W line for 135.58 feet back to the Point of Beginning.
Said parcel is a part of the SE 1/4 of the NE 1/4 and a part of the SW 1/4 of the NE 1/4 of Section 6, T-5-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi and contains 8.00 acres, more or less.
Together with any improvements thereon and appurtenances thereunto belonging.
LESS AND EXCEPT all of the oil, gas, and other minerals of like kind and character in, on, and under the above described property.
 
AND ALSO:
 
Commence at a concrete monument marking the SE corner of the NE 1/4 of Section 6, T-S-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi and run N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along the South line of said NE 1/4 for 993.75 feet to a railroad spike and the centerline of Lott Town Road (Paved Public Road); thence continue N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 41.27 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar and the West R/W line of said Lott Town Road; thence continue N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 458.30 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence continue N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 608.01 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar and the POINT OF BEGINNING, from said POINT OF BEGINNING run N 48 degrees 14 minutes 23 seconds E for 1083.40 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar and the aforementioned West R/W line of Lott Town Road; thence run S 07 degrees 47 minutes 22 seconds E along said R/W line for 381.30 feet to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence continue along said R/W line and along a curve which bears to the left having a radius of 443.11 feet, a length of 6.40 feet, and a chord bearing and distance of S 08 degrees 30 minutes 51 seconds E and 6.40 feet, respectively, to a 1/2 inch rebar; thence leaving said R/W line run S 68 degrees 35 minutes 36 seconds W for 924.56 feet back to the POINT OF BEGINNING. Said parcel of land is a part of the NE 1/4 of Section 6, T-5-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi and contains 4.00 acres, more or less.
 
Less and except:
 
A parcel or tract of land, containing 4.0 acres more or less, lying and being situated in NE1/4 of Section 6, T-5-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi, and being more particularly described as follows:
 
Commence at a concrete monument marking the SE corner of the NE1/4 of Section 6, T-5-N, R-14-W, Forrest County, Mississippi and run N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along the South line of said NE1/4 for 993.75 feet to a railroad spike and the centerline of Lott Town Road (Paved Public Road); thence continue N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 41.27 feet to a 1/2 rebar and the Point of Beginning. From said Point of Beginning continue N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 468.30 feet to a 1/2 rebar; thence continue N 89 degrees 45 minutes 47 seconds W along said South line for 608.01 feet to a 1/2 rebar; thence run N 68 degrees 35 minutes 36 seconds E for 924.56 feet to a 1/2 rebar and the aforementioned West R/W line of Lott Town Road; thence run along said R/W line and along a curve which bears to the left having a radius of 443.11 feet, a length of 276.72 feet, and a chord bearing and distance of S 26 degrees 49 minutes 06 seconds E and 272.24 feet, respectively, to a 1/2 rebar; thence run S 43 degrees 08 minutes 00 seconds E along said R/W line for 135.58 feet back to the Point of Beginning.
 
Being the same property described in that Warranty Deed from Kenyora Todd, Kadejah Todd and Kiara Foxworth, Grantors, to Subrina Mason, Grantee, filed for record on May 28, 2020 in Book 1338 at Page 173, Land Deed Records of Forrest County, Mississippi.

NOW, THEREFORE, McPhail Sanchez, LLC, Substituted Trustee in said deed of trust, will on December 10, 2025 offer for sale at public outcry through duly appointed auctioneer and sell within legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.), at the Northeast Rear Entrance of the Paul B. Johnson Chancery Building of Forrest County, 641 North Main Street, Hattiesburg, MS 39401 to the highest and best bidder for cash the following described property situated in Forrest County, Mississippi, to-wit:
 
The following described real property, lying and being situate in Forrest County, Mississippi, described as follows, to-wit:
 
Tract I:
 
The unexpired portion of that 16th Section lease for a term of 99 years from October 21, 1947, recorded in Book 98 at Page 465 in and to the following described land. A part of Block 76 of the D.D. McInnis Third Survey of the City of Hattiesburg, County, of Forrest, State of Mississippi, as per the map or plat thereof on file in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi, and being more particularly described as follows:
 
Commence at a point on the West boundary line of West Pine Street, formerly known as Lewin Avenue, 269 feet Southwest from the Northeast corner of Block 76 of said Survey, and run Southwestward along said Pine Street for a distance of 63 feet, thence run at right angles Northwestward for a distance of 130 feet, thence at right angles Northeastward for a distance of 63 feet, thence at right angles Southeastward for a distance of 130 feet, to the Point of Beginning, being a strip of land fronting 63 feet on West Pine Street, formerly known as Lewin Avenue, and extending back between parallel lines a distance of 130 feet, same being in Section 16, Township 4 North, Range 13 West, in the County of Forrest, State of Mississippi;
 
And also,

The unexpired portion of that 16th Section lease for a term of 99 years from June 7, 1947, recorded in Book 96 at Page 333 in and to the following described land. A part of Block 76 of the D.D. McInnis Third Survey of the City of Hattiesburg, County, of Forrest, State of Mississippi, as per the map or plat thereof on file in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi, and being more particularly described as follows:
 
Commencing at a point on the West boundary line of West Pine Street, formerly known as Lewin Avenue, 209 feet Southwest from the Northeast corner of Block 76 of said survey, and run Southwest along said Pine Street 60 feet; thence run at right angles Northwest 130 feet; thence at right angles Northeast 60 feet; thence run at right angles 130 feet Southeast to the Point of Beginning, being a strip of land fronting 60 feet on West Pine Street, formerly known as Lewin Avenue, and extending back between parallel lines a distance of 130 feet, same being a part of Block 76 of said D.D. McInnis Third Survey and of Section 16, Township 4 North, Range 13 West, in the County of Forrest, State of Mississippi;
 
And also,
 
Tract III:
 
The unexpired portion of that 16th Section lease for a term of 99 years from January 6, 1948, recorded in Book 100 at Page 272 in and to the following described land. A part of Block 76 of the D.D. McInnis Third Survey of the City of Hattiesburg, County, of Forrest, State of Mississippi, as per the map or plat thereof on file in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi, and being more particularly described as follows:
 
Commencing at the Northeast corner of said Block 76 at the intersection of the Northwesterly boundary line of West Pine Street with the Southwesterly boundary line of Royal Street and run thence in a Southwesterly direction along the Northwesterly boundary line of West Pine Street a distance of 159 feet to the Point of Beginning, and from said Point of Beginning continue in a Southwesterly direction along the Northwesterly boundary line of West Pine Street a distance of 50 feet, run thence in a Northwesterly direction at right angles to West Pine Street a distance of 130 feet, run thence in a Northeasterly direction parallel with West Pine Street a distance of 50 feet and run thence in a Southeasterly direction at right angles to West Pine Street a distance of 130 feet to the Point of Beginning;
 
And also,
 
Tract IV:
 
A part of Block 76 of the D.D. McInnis Third Survey of the City of Hattiesburg, County, of Forrest, State of Mississippi, as per the map or plat thereof on file in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi, and being more particularly described as follows:

RULE 81 SUMMONS BY PUBLICATION FOR
WRONGFUL DEATH BENEFICIARIES AND UNKNOWN
HEIRS AT LAW
IN THE CHANCERY COURT OF FORREST COUNTY, MISSISSIPPI
IN THE MATTER OF THE ESTATE OF TRISTAN H. BRADFORD, A MINOR, DECEASED CIVIL ACTION NO. 25-pr-00268-SM
ROBERT LEE BRADFORD, PETITIONER  
TO:The Wrongful Death Beneficiaries and the Unknown Heirs at Law of Tristan H. Bradford, Deceased
You have been made a Defendant in the Petition to Determine the Wrongful Death Beneficiaries and the Unknown Heirs at Law in this Court by Robert Lee Bradford, in which he seeks to determine the Wrongful Death Beneficiaries and the Unknown Heirs at Law of Tristan Hunter Bradford, deceased, and asserts that Robert Lee Bradford, Amber Magee, Kylah Magee, Brynlee Bradford, and Debbie Lynn Bradford are the sole Wrongful Death Beneficiaries and the Unknown Heirs at Law of Tristan Hunter Bradford, deceased. Petitioner further prays as follows:
You are summoned to appear and defend against the Petition at 9:00 a.m. on the 5th day of January, 2026, in the Courtroom of the Forrest County Chancery Courthouse, 641 Main Street, Hattiesburg, Mississippi, and in case of your failure to appear and defend, a Judgment will be entered against you for the money or things demanded in the Petition. You are not required to file an Answer or other pleading but may do so if you so desire.
If you desire to file an Answer, you must mail or hand deliver a written response to the petition in this action to R. Lane Dossett, Attorney for Petitioner, whose address is 228 Pine Lane, Hattiesburg, MS 39402; and you must also file the original of your response with the Clerk of this Court. Issued under my hand and the seal of said Court, this the 17 day of November, A.D., 2025.
BY:     GWEN WILKS, CHANCERY CLERK

SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE SALE
 
WHEREAS on March 23, 2022, EARNESTINE MOORE, A SINGLE WOMAN, executed a Deed of Trust to PILGER TITLE CO., as Trustee , and MORTGAGE ELECTRONIC REGISTRATION SYSTEM, SOLELY AS NOMINEE FOR CALIBER HOME LOANS, INC, its successors and assigns, as Beneficiary, which Deed of Trust is on file and of record in the office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest, Mississippi, in Deed of Trust Record at Book 2416, Page 517 – and as Instrument Number 835431; and
WHEREAS, MORTGAGE ELECTRONIC REGISTRATION SYSTEM, SOLELY AS NOMINEE FOR CALIBER HOME LOANS, INC. duly transferred and assigned said Deed of Trust to NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing via an instrument filed on March 21,y 2023, in Book 2472, Page 715.
WHEREAS, NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing substituted Padgett Law Group as Trustee in place of the afore-mentioned original Trustee via an instrument dated November 17, 2025 and recorded in Book 2607, Page 672 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
WHEREAS, default has occurred in the payment of the indebtedness secured by said deed(s) of trust, and NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, as beneficiary, has authorized and instructed Padgett Law Group as substitute trustee to foreclose said deed(s) of trust by advertisement and sale at public auction in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor.
THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that pursuant to the power of sale contained in said deed(s) of trust and in accordance with the statutes made and provided therefor, the said deed(s) of trust will be foreclosed and the property covered thereby and hereinafter described will be sold at public auction to the highest bidder for cash at the northeast rear entrance of the Paul B. Johnson Chancery Building in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, and will sell within legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 AM and 4:00 PM) on December 18, 2025, to satisfy the indebtedness now due under and secured by said deed(s) of trust.
Padgett Law Group will convey only such title as vested in it as Substituted Trustee. The premises to be sold are described as:
THE SOUTH 30 FEET OF LOT 4 AND ALL OF LOT 5 OF BLOCK 21 OF THE HATTIESBURG HEIGHTS PROPER SURVEY TO THE CITY OF HATTIESBURG, COUNTY OF FORREST, STATE OF MISSISSIPPI, AS PER THE MAP OR PLAT THEREOF ON FILE IN THE OFFICE OF THE CHANCERY CLERK OF FORREST COUNTY.
The successful bidder must tender full funds at the conclusion of the sale in the form of a certified check made payable or endorsed to Padgett Law Group. No personal checks will be accepted. To this end you must bring sufficient funds to outbid the lender and any other bidders. Insufficient funds will not be accepted. Amounts received in excess of the winning bid will be refunded. Padgett Law Group reserves the right to award the bid to the next highest bidders should the highest bidder fail to timely tender the total amount due.
 
November 20, 2025
 
Padgett Law Group Substituted Trustee

FIRE RESCUE TOOLS

SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE’S NOTICE OF SALE
 
STATE OF MISSISSIPPI
COUNTY OF FORREST
 
WHEREAS, on September 9, 2008, Brenda C. Sanderson and Mark Sanderson executed a deed of trust to First American Title, Trustee for the benefit of Vanderbilt Mortgage and Finance, Inc., which deed of trust was recorded on September 16, 2008, Book 1660 at Page 398 in the Office of the Chancery Clerk of Forrest County, Mississippi; and
 
WHEREAS, Vanderbilt Mortgage and Finance, Inc., the holder of said deed of trust and the note secured thereby, substituted Lori C. Baird as Trustee therein, as authorized by the terms thereof, by instrument dated October 14, 2025, and recorded on October 21, 2025 in the Office of the aforesaid Chancery Clerk in Book 2603 at Page 194 as Instrument# 882257; and
 
WHEREAS, default having been made in the terms and conditions of said deed of trust, and the entire debt secured thereby having been declared to be due and payable in accordance with the terms of said deed of trust, and the legal holder of said indebtedness, Vanderbilt Mortgage and Finance, Inc., having requested the undersigned Substitute Trustee to execute the trust and sell said land and property in accordance with the terms of said deed of trust for the purpose of raising the sums due thereunder, together with attorney’s fees, substitute trustee’s fees and expenses of sale;
 
NOW, THEREFORE, I, Lori C. Baird, Substitute Trustee in said deed of trust will, on the 12th day of December, 2025, offer for sale at public outcry for cash to the highest bidder, and sell within legal hours (being between the hours of 11:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.) at the northeast main entrance (back door) of the Paul B. Johnson, Jr., Chancery Building, located at 641 Main Street, in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, the following described property situated in the County of Forrest, State of Mississippi, to-wit:
 
A part of the NW ¼ of the SW ¼ of Section 2, Township 5 North, Range 14 West, Forrest County, Mississippi, and being more particularly described as beginning 840 feet North of the SE corner of the N ½ of the SW ¼ of the SW ¼ of said Section 2 and thence run North for 369.60 feet; thence run West for 380.00 to the Point of Beginning; thence continue West for 250.00 feet; thence run S 00° 39’ 31” E for 174.46 feet; thence run East for 250.00 feet; thence run N 00° 39’ 31” W for 174.46 feet to the Point of Beginning, comprising 1 acre, more or less.
 
AND ALSO AN EASEMENT FOR INGRESS AND EGRESS:
 
A part of the NW ¼ of the SW ¼ and a part of the SW ¼ of the SW ¼, all in Section 2, Township 5 North, Range 14 West, Forrest County, Mississippi, being more particularly described as: Beginning at a point on the centerline of a 20 foot Access Easement being 10 feet either side of the following described centerline that is located 1036.00 feet North of and 618.00 feet West of the SE corner of the N ½ of the said SW ¼ of the said SW ¼; thence run S 00° 40’ 14” E along said centerline for 70.21 feet; thence run West along said centerline for 356.04 feet; thence run S 00° 04’ 05” W along said centerline for 20.00 feet; thence run West along said centerline for 108.00 feet; thence run S 08° 00’ 00” W along said centerline for 536.00 feet to a point on the North right of way line of Pep’s Point Road, said point being the Point of Termination. Containing 0.50 acres, more or less.
 
ALSO: One (1) 2007 Clayton manufactured home, VIN# CS2008768TNAB.
 
Said property shall be sold as is, where is. I will convey only such title as is vested in me as Substitute Trustee. The full purchase price must be paid in cash or by certified funds at the time of sale.
 
WITNESS my signature this the 5th day of November, 2025.
 
                                                                        /s/ Lori C. Baird
                                                                        Substitute Trustee
 
To be published on November 14, November 21, November 28, December 5, 2025.

NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING
ON
PROPOSED ISSUANCE OF BONDS

The Mississippi Home Corporation (the Corporation) proposes to issue not to exceed $100,000,000 aggregate principal amount of Mississippi Home Corporation Single Family Mortgage Revenue Bonds, Series 2026A (Non-AMT) (the Bonds) in order to provide funds for the purpose of financing the acquisition of mortgage-backed securities backed by mortgage loans on residential housing units within the State made to qualified persons and families, as set forth in the 2026AB Series Resolution to be considered by the Board of the Corporation at a meeting to be held on December 10, 2025 and as authorized by the General Bond Resolution adopted by the Board of the Corporation on July 15, 2009.

PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that the Corporation will hold a public hearing at 735 Riverside Drive, Jackson, Mississippi 39202, on December 3, 2025, at 9:00 a.m. at which time any person may be heard, either orally or in writing, regarding the sale and issuance of the Bonds and the use of the proceeds thereof.  Written statements not presented at the hearing should be directed to the Corporation at the above address on or before 9:00 a.m. on December 3, 2025.

The notice is being published in accordance with the applicable public notice requirements of Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code), Treasury Regulation Section 1.147(f)*1, and other applicable regulations promulgated under the Code.  All affected taxpayers, property owners and citizens of the State of Mississippi are invited to attend said hearing and present comments and discussion concerning the proposed sale and issuance of the Bonds and the use of the proceeds thereof.

More specific information concerning the Bonds is available for inspection at the office of the Corporation at the above address.
 
                                                            /s/Scott Spivey
                                                            Executive Director

Advertisement for Bids
The Board of Trustees of Forrest County General Hospital will receive sealed proposals for the following:
ASBURY HOSPICE HOUSE 
ADDITIONS AND RENOVATIONS
CN 24-4063J

SEALED BIDS
Time for Receipt: Sealed bids will be received until 10:00 A.m. CST, on wednesday, DECEMBER 17, 2025.
               
Location for Receipt:                                        
The Eagle Room
FORREST GENERAL HOSPITAL support services building, on 3rd floor
125 South 28th avenue
HATTIESBURG, MISSISSIPPI 39402
 
ELECTRONIC BIDDING OPTION:
BIDS MAY BE SUBMITTED IN PERSON OR, FOR THOSE INTERESTED, BIDS CAN BE ELECTRONICALLY SUBMITTED AT www.llgarchplans.com  UNDER THE PROJECT NAME.
 
Bid Opening: Bids received on time will be opened publicly and read aloud in the eagle room of THE forrest general hospital - support services building, on 3rd floor, promptly after time for receipt.
               
A voluntary Pre-Bid conference will be held at 10:00 a.m. CST, on WEDNESDAY December 10, 2025 at the following location:
 
The Eagle Room
Forrest General Hospital - support services building, on 3rd floor
125 South 28TH Avenue
Hattiesburg, Mississippi 39402
               
PROJECT DESCRIPTION
THE ADDITIONS TO ASBURY HOSPICE HOUSE INCLUDE A NEW STAND-ALONE PHARMACY BUILDING, COVERED OUTDOOR CONNECTING BREEZEWAY, PAVILION FOR ACTIVITIES LOCATED BEHIND THE EXISTING FACILITY AND SOME INTERIOR RENOVATIONS AS INDICATED ON THE DRAWINGS.
               
Contracting Arrangement: A single lump sum contract shall be let for the complete Work described in the Bidding Documents.
               
               
DOCUMENTS
Plan Holders are required to register and order bid documents at www.llgarchplans.com.  Bid documents are non-refundable and must be purchased through the website. All plan holders are required to have a valid email address for registration. Please contact Plan House Printing, 1a Churchill Street, Hattiesburg, MS, 39402, 601-336-6378 for questions regarding website registration and online orders. THE COST of bid documents shall be $400.00 per hard copy and $200.00 per digital copy.
               
BIDDING REQUIREMENTS
Bids shall be submitted in duplicate only upon the blank bid forms provided with the project manual and must be accompanied by bid security in the form of a certified check or acceptable bid bond in an amount equal to at least five percent (5%) of the base bid. Said security to be forfeited, as liquidated damages, not penalty, by a bidder who may be awarded the contract, but who fails to carry out the terms of the proposal, execute the contract and post the required performance and payment bonds in the form and amount, and within the time specified. The bid bond, or the certified check, if used in lieu thereof, shall be payable unconditionally to Forrest County General Hospital.
               
Bids on the project must be received on or before the time specified above, and no bid may be withdrawn after the scheduled closing time and date for the receipt of bids for a period of forty-five (45) days. All bids submitted must comply with the requirements of Chapter 3, Title 31 (Sections 31-3-1, et. seq.) of the Mississippi Code of 1972, as amended, and the performance of any contract awarded shall be bonded in accordance with Chapter 5, Title 31 of the Mississippi Code of 1972, as amended.
               
Bidders who are non-residents of the State of Mississippi must also comply with the provisions of Section 31-3-21(3) of the Mississippi Code of 1972, as amended.
               
The Board reserves the right to reject any and all bids and to waive informalities.
Dated this 19TH DAY OF November, A.D. 2025.
CHARLIE WILLIAMSON, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, FACILITIES SERVICES, PROPERTY MANAGEMENT, FORREST GENERAL HOSPITAL

Advertisement for Sealed Proposals
 
Southern Mississippi Planning & Development District (SMPDD), as the fiscal agent for the Twin Districts Workforce Development Area (TDWDA), is seeking vendors who can provide temporary staffing and payroll services to justice-impacted adults for work-based learning initiatives to assist re-entering the workforce within the TDWDA. Eligible vendors must be able to: pay assigned employees’ wages, withhold and transmit payroll taxes, provide unemployment insurance and workers compensation benefits, and address unemployment and workers’ compensation claims. Funding may be provided through the Partners for Reentry Opportunities in Workforce Development (PROWD) Grant, RESTORE Act, and/or Pathway Home 5. The program will serve any or all of the following counties of Clarke, Covington, Forrest, George, Greene, Hancock, Harrison, Jackson, Jasper, Jefferson Davis, Jones, Kemper, Lamar, Lauderdale, Leake, Marion, Neshoba, Newton, Perry, Pearl River, Scott, Smith, Stone and Wayne. This advertisement is conducted pursuant to the requirements, conditions and the applicable regulations and policies of the State of Mississippi, Mississippi Department of Employment Security, AccelerateMS, Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality, U.S. Department of Labor, U.S. Department of Justice, U.S. Department of Treasury, and Southern Mississippi Planning & Development District.
Copies of the Request for Proposals (RFP) will be available from Southern Mississippi Planning & Development District, beginning November 13, 2025. Copies of the RFP can be obtained on or after this date by downloading a copy of from the SMPDD website at www.smpdd.com/rfp_publicnotice. Completed proposal packages should be submitted to Southern Mississippi Planning & Development District, 10441 Corporate Dr., Ste. 1, Gulfport, MS 39503. Proposals may also be submitted electronically via email to Grant Wesley at gwesley@smpdd.com. Proposals are due no later than 12:00 p.m. CST December 4, 2025; proposals received after this deadline will not be considered responsive to this RFP. The initial contract awarded will be through December 31, 2026, with the option to extend the contract annually up to three years with the approval of both parties, dependent on funding. The successful Proposer shall comply with all 2 CFR 200 requirements.
Minority and Woman Owned Business Enterprises are solicited to submit proposals on this project as prime contractors and are encouraged to make inquiries regarding potential subcontracting opportunities, equipment, material and/or supply needs.
The three Re-entry programs noted above are 100% federally funded. The PROWD grant is funded through the MDES with funding from the US Department of Labor under the Employment and Training Administration. The project was awarded to SMPDD for $1,500,000. The Pathway Home 5 funding was awarded through the Employment and Training Administration and the Department of Labor in the amount of $2,999,000. Additionally, the ARP program was funded through the RESTORE Council and the Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality under the Resources and Ecosystems Sustainability, Tourist Opportunities, and Revived Economies of the Gulf Coast States Act of 2012, in the amount of $1,223,006.31 (award GNSSP23MS0045).
SMPDD is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and hereby notifies that all Proposers will be afforded the full opportunity to submit proposals in response to this advertisement for proposals and will not be discriminated against on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual preference, marital or veteran status, or any other legally protected status in consideration for an award.
SMPDD reserves the right to waive any informality or to reject any or all Proposals with or without reason.
Questions or comments concerning this advertisement for proposals shall be directed to Patricia Morrison – Workforce Development Manager at SMPDD by email at pmorrison@smpdd.com no later than 4:00 p.m. November 24, 2025.

LEGAL NOTICE FOR OPEN PUBLIC HEARING
MDOT Job No. SP-0059-01(135) / 109496-101000,
SP-0210-00(045) / 109496-102000, & SP-9339-00(011) / 109496-103000
I-59 AT US 11 INTERCHANGE OPERATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS
FORREST COUNTY
 
The Mississippi Department of Transportation (MDOT), in coordination with the Federal Highway Administration (FHWA), will conduct an Open Forum Public Hearing to present the Preferred Alternative and the Preliminary Environmental Assessment (EA) for the proposed I-59 at US 11 Interchange Operational Improvements in Forrest County.
 
The Preliminary EA promotes informed decision-making in the development of a transportation solution(s) by explaining the purpose and need of the proposed action, evaluating social, economic, and environmental impacts, soliciting feedback from the public and decision-makers, and determining whether further analysis is necessary or if the impacts are minimal enough to warrant a Finding of No Significant Impact (FONSI).
 
The purpose of this Public Hearing is to present the evaluated range of alternatives with the identified Preferred Alternative for the project and to solicit comments. The hearing will be held from 4:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m. on Thursday, November 20, 2025, at the Okahola Community Center, 59 Old Okahola Road, Purvis, MS.
 
Citizens are invited to come and go as they please during the hours of the hearing to view MDOT’s plans and exhibits, ask questions, and offer comments. Although there will be no provisions made for formal presentations by individuals or groups, citizens are encouraged to make written and/or taped comments that will become part of the hearing’s permanent record.
 
The Preliminary EA is available for public review and comments online and in person at the locations below. Comments will be accepted until Friday, December 5, 2025.
 
• Website: https://mdot.ms.gov/portal/environmental
• MDOT – Environmental Division- 401 North West Street, Jackson, MS 39201
• MDOT Sixth District Office – 6356 US 49, Hattiesburg, MS 39401
• Hattiesburg City Hall – 200 Forrest St, Hattiesburg, MS 39401
• Purvis Public Library – 122 Shelby Speights Dr, Purvis, MS 39475
• Oak Grove Public Library – 4958 Old Hwy 11, Hattiesburg, MS 39402
• Federal Highway Administration – 100 West Capitol Street, Suite 1062, Jackson, MS 39269
 
The public is invited and encouraged to visit https://mdot.ms.gov/portal/environmental to view the project information and offer comments. Anyone with limited internet access or general questions or comments regarding the Preliminary EA or Public Hearing may call (601)-359-7920. Any person wishing to submit written comments may send them to MDOT, Attn: April Fairley, P.O. Box 1850, Jackson, MS 39215, or by email to environmentalcomments@mdot.ms.gov. Comments must be submitted by Friday, December 5, 2025.
 
Anyone needing project information or special accommodations under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) is encouraged to contact April Fairley at (601) 359-7920. Hearing or speech impaired, please contact the Mississippi Relay System at (Voice/TTY 711). Requests should be made at least four days prior to the Public Hearing end date.
 
Adam Johnson
Environmental Division Director
Mississippi Department of Transportation
